AVSEC Order  No. 20/2011 
Subject:- 
National Civil Aviation Security Training Programme, 2011 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification 
No.1797, dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security(Civil Aviation), for the 
purpose of  securing the aircraft operations and access  control at the  civil  
airports in India directs that the National Civil Aviation Security Training 
Programme, which has been updated  to comply with the  requirements  of  
Standards  of  Annex-17 to  the  Convention on International Civil Aviation, shall be 
implemented by all agencies connected  with civil aviation security in  India. 
 
2. 
This  is  in succession of  AVSEC Order  No. 3/2004 dated 3.3.2004. 
 
3. 
The  above  AVSEC Order shall be implemented with immediate effect. Any 
violation of this AVSEC Order  shall attract  penalty under section 11A of  the 
Aircraft Act, 1934. 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS) 
Commissioner of  Security  (CA )
